data.title: Keller Funeral Home Obituaries
data.meta_description: Discover the latest and historic obituaries from Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home. Find tributes, condolences, and celebration of life stories for loved ones in our online archive.
data.meta_site_name: Eulogy Assistant - Funeral Writing Support Service

A Legacy of Compassion and Care: Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home

Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home, located at 416 South Arch Street, Fremont, OH, 43420, has been a pillar of support for families in the community for generations. With a rich history and a commitment to providing exceptional service, this funeral home has earned a reputation as a trusted and caring partner during life's most difficult moments.

A History of Service and Dedication

Founded on a foundation of compassion and respect, Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home has been serving the Fremont community since [year]. Over the years, the funeral home has remained family-owned and operated, with a focus on providing personalized attention to each family they serve. This dedication to excellence has earned them a reputation as one of the most respected funeral homes in the area.

Hanneman- Keller Funeral Home

Address: 416 South Arch Street, Fremont, OH, 43420

Phone Number: 419-332-8288

Get Direction: Google Maps Link

Funeral Obiturary Search

Explore our extensive database to find and remember the lives of loved ones through millions of heartfelt obituaries

Recent Funeral Home Obituaries

Mary B Benner - February 02, 1935 - March 15, 2024

Departed: 03/15/2024 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Mary Benner passed away March 15, 2024, peacefully in her home. Mary was born on February 2, 1935, to Salvatore (Sam) Ruggiero and Maria (Reino) Ruggiero. She graduated from Gibsonburg High School in 1953. Mary married Alfred Hoffmann on August 18, 1956, and they were married for 23 wonderful years before he passed away. She married John Benner on November 23, 1988, and has spent the last 35 years married to her best friend. She was a devoted wife, mother, sister, grandmother, great-grandmother, aunt, cousin, and friend; all who will remember her contagious smile, ability to always see the positive pure joy in everything, and her arms open with rocking hugs. Mary was an avid sports fan, especially the Fighting Irish and the Buckeyes. She enjoyed spending time with her family and was especially proud of her Italian heritage. She is survived by her children: Laura (Gene) Baker, Dan Hoffmann, and Joe Hoffmann; sister: Susie Rusher; brother: Anthony (Ruthann) Ruggiero; grandchildren: Nick (Lindsay) Baker, Amanda (Johny) Ibanez, Hannah Hoffmann and Chris Hergesheimer, Andrew Hoffmann, Christian Hoffmann; Step-children: Mark (Jean) Benner, Chuck (Jodi) Benner, Pete (Jolynn) Benner, Mike (Carol) Benner, Matt (Lisa) Benner, Teresa Gordon, John Benner; Step grandchildren: Philip (Madeline) Benner, Stephanie (Gavin) Beard, Erica (Jim) Baumer, Jessica (Brian) Skinner, Courtney (Josh) Terry, Chad (Leah) Benner, Curt (Jill) Benner, Mitch (Amanda) Benner, Lauren (Thomas) Wilson, Angela (Jeff) Finn, Ashley Benner, Alison Benner, Adam Benner, Andrew (Katie) Benner, Megan (Evan) Gordon, Becca Gordon, Derek (Kady) Benner, Shannon Benner; may great grandchildren. Mary was preceded in death by her parents, husband: Alfred Hoffmann; brothers: Nick, Patsey, Carmine Ruggiero; sisters: Maria Ruggiero, Concetta Hoffman; daughter in law: Stacy Benner; son-in law: Jerry Gordon. A special thank you to the Heartland Hospice team for their wonderful care and support. Thank you to the Dorothy Kern Cancer Center for their care and compassion.

View Full Obituary

Michael Joseph Molyet - July 03, 1947 - March 02, 2024

Departed: 03/02/2024 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Michael Joseph Molyet, 76, formerly of Fremont, passed away on March 2, 2024. He was born in Fremont, OH to the late Donald and Rita (Ochs) Molyet. Michael was a 1965 graduate of St. Joseph Central Catholic High School in Fremont. He continued his education at Bowling Green State University, where he received his Bachelor's degree in 1973. On May 3, 1974, Michael married his late wife, Elaine (Rudes) Molyet. Michael spent most of his career in Human Resources working at Morton Salt and Central Soya. His compassion and dedication touched the lives of many throughout his time in the field. He found great fulfillment in his work, always striving to make a positive impact on those around him. In his free time Michael enjoyed boating and traveling with wife Elaine, tinkering around in his wood shop, cruising around in his convertible Mustang and spending time with his many different German Shepard companions over the years. Michael will always be remembered for his kindness, warm smile, and the love he shared with those around him. May he rest in peace, knowing his spirit lives on in the hearts of all who were fortunate enough to know him. He is survived by his son; Jason (Ann-Marie) Molyet, sisters-in-law; Diane Molyet and Eileen Molyet, several nieces and nephews, and his faithful dog, Buck. Michael was preceded in death by his parents, loving wife, and brothers; Jeff Molyet and Bryan Molyet.

View Full Obituary

Donald Ochs - February 23, 1939 - February 26, 2024

Departed: 02/26/2024 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Donald Ochs, a beloved husband, father, and grandfather passed away peacefully on February 26, 2024, at his home in Fremont, Ohio. He was born on February 23, 1939, in Fremont to Wilfred and Agnes (Nieset) Ochs. Donald's commitment to his family was unwavering and defined his existence. Donald graduated from St. Joseph Catholic High School in 1958. Donald's warm smile and compassionate nature will be remembered by his family and friends. On April 8,1961, Donald married the love of his life, Leah Hawk, in Angola, IN. He was a long-time member of Sacred Heart Church. Don worked as a supervisor at Whirlpool Corp. for 31 years. In his free time Don enjoyed woodworking, gardening, but mostly, gatherings with his family. Surviving to cherish his memory: wife, Leah Ochs; daughters, Tamara (Scott) Miller, Jacqueline (Brad Wiltse) Combs, and Jennifer (Timothy) Meggitt; brothers, Eugene Ochs and Robert (Kathy) Ochs; grandchildren, Jessica (Aric) Rosenberger, Amanda (Jacob) Crispen, Jacob Combs, Alexandra (Jeff) Mapus, Olivia (Mark) Maloney, Trevor Meade, Victoria (Kyle Croucher) Miller, and Jared Combs as well as 10 great grandchildren. Donald was preceded in death by his parents; twin sons, Michael and Mark Ochs; brothers Frank Ochs and James Ochs; Sister-in-laws, Fayanne Ochs and Sally Ochs, and Son-in-law Jim Combs. The memories of Donald's kindness and generosity will live on in the hearts of all who were fortunate enough to have known him. He will be deeply missed and forever cherished. Donald’s family would like to thank Elara Caring Hospice, Elmwood Nursing Facility, and the nursing staff at Memorial Hospital for taking such great care of him.

View Full Obituary

James Logsdon - April 01, 1951 - February 22, 2024

Departed: 02/22/2024 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: James Richard "Jim" Logsdon, 72, of Hamilton,NY, passed away unexpectedly Thursday, February 22, 2024. He was born April 1, 1951 in Fremont, Ohio to Gilbert and Betty (Hayes) Logsdon. Jim earned his Bachelor's degree in Business Management from Tiffin University where he was a member of Delta Beta Chapter of the Phi Theta Pi fraternity. He had a successful career working for Waste Management, Inc. for 35 years and held many positions including Vice President of Operations. Upon his retirement Jim, continued as an entrepreneur and consultant in the waste industry. He was an Eagle Scout with the Fremont St. Joesph School, Boy Scout Troop 304, and a member of the Knights of Columbus. Jim cherished his time living and working at his family's 65-acre farm in Hamilton, NY, Saddleback Farm. He is survived by his wife of 23 years, Valerie (Hackney) Logsdon; his children, Kristie (Jeremiah) Vergowven of Newport, MI, Lori (Eldon) Hallows of Waynesville, OH, Nicole (Maurice) Tommie of Tampa, Fl and James Ryan (Andrea) Logsdon of Jacksonville, FL; his brothers, John (Andrea) Logsdon of Tiffin, OH and Thomas "Buzz" Logsdon of Newmarket, NH; his grandchildren, Jackson Vergowven, Brynn Hallows, Ava Hallows, Grayson Logsdon, Nathaniel Logsdon, Javian Tommie, Nyrobi Logsdon, June Logsdon, Aja Tommie and Kairo Tommie as well as several nieces and nephews. In addition to family, Jim left an impact on countless friends and community members. Friends of Jim could rely on him for support or to lend a hand in their time of need. Jim was predeceased by his parents, Gilbert and Betty Logsdon.

View Full Obituary

Robert L Dolweck - March 09, 1934 - February 04, 2024

Departed: 02/04/2024 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Robert L. Dolweck, 89, of Fremont, passed away on February 4, 2024 surrounded by his loving family. He was born on March 9, 1934, in Fremont to the late Leo and Pearl (Swanitz) Dolweck. Robert was a 1952 graduate from St. Joseph Central Catholic High School. After high school he married the love of his life, Margaret. They spent over 70 years together. He and his wife were the owners and operators of R &M Laundromat in Fremont for 50 years. Robert was also a school bus driver for Fremont City Schools for 31 years. Robert is survived by his wife, Margaret; children Robert (Judy) Dolweck, Christine (Phil) Henry, Janice (Russell) Damman, and Richard Dolweck; 7 grandchildren; 13 great-grandchildren, and 4 great-great-grandchildren. He was preceded in death by his parents and sisters; Margaret Humburg and Dolores Bean.

View Full Obituary

Beverly Jeanne Whisler - December 10, 1932 - January 16, 2024

Departed: 01/16/2024 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Beverly Jeanne (Baumann) Whisler, age 91, died peacefully January 16, 2024, at Valleyview Care Center surrounded by the love of family and friends. She was born in Fremont on December 10, 1932, to Henry and Donna (Zimmerman) Baumann. Bev was a proud graduate of the class of 1950 at Fremont Ross High School. She attended Toledo Hospital School of Nursing, graduating in 1953. Her entire nursing career was spent at Memorial Hospital in Fremont, where she held a number of positions. After retirement in 1997 she was busier than ever, volunteering at the hospital as well as Hayes School and the Liberty Center. She also enjoyed spending time with her flower beds and traveling with family and friends. As grandchildren and great-grandchildren joined the family, she took great delight in spending time with them and keeping up with their lives. Bev is survived by daughter Betsy (Rusty) Aten, son Joe (Jane), son John (Brenda), daughter-in-law Kathy Whisler. Also survived by grandchildren Danielle (Ken) Luc, Jessica (Justin) Morelli, Tod (Ash) Whisler, Paige (AJ) Kissh, Shane Whisler, Brett Whisler (Maija), Scott Whisler (Courtney), Katarina (Colin) Shepherd, Zachary Whisler; great-grandchildren Kaitlyn (Tyler) Binder, Evan Luc, Lauren Beverly Luc, Evelyn Morelli, Jensen Kissh, Charlotte Whisler, Oliver Whisler; sister, Lucy Hull; nieces and nephews. She was preceded in death by her parents, sister Martha Hetrick, son Andy Whisler, brothers-in-law Don Hetrick and Keith Hull. The family would like to extend their heartfelt appreciation to the staff at Valleyview for their loving care of Bev during her time there, especially Jodi and Jill in assisted living and Margie and Tammy in the care center, also to her faithful friends Shirley, Paula, Gloria, Diane, Brenda, and Peggy. A memorial service will be held at Trinity United Methodist Church, 204 North Wayne Street, on Saturday, February 17, 2024. Visitation will begin at 9:30 am with service to follow at 11 am. Memorial donations can be made to School of Hope or The Sight Center. Hanneman Funeral Homes is honored to serve Bev's family and encourage those to share a fond memory or condolence by visiting www.hannemanfuneralhomes.com

View Full Obituary

Cinda Jones - July 19, 1948 - January 14, 2024

Departed: 01/14/2024 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Cinda Jones, a beloved sister and cherished friend, passed away on January 14, 2024, at the age of 75. Cinda was born on July 19, 1948, in Fremont, OH, to the late Henry and Georgia (Longanbaugh) Nitschke. She married the love of her life, John "Jack" Jones, on July 14, 1973. Cinda was a 1966 graduate of Fremont Ross High School. After high school, she attended Golden Valley Bible College in Minneapolis, Minnesota where she graduated with a Bachelor's degree in social work. She was a Certified Church Social Worker for many years. She followed in the family footsteps and became a florist while residing in Wisconsin with her husband. She also worked for the Wisconsin Corrections Department for 15 years as a dietitian. Cinda was currently employed with Always Answer taking calls for doctors' offices. As much as she enjoyed working, Cinda had many interested personally. She was a proud longtime member of Faith Lutheran Church in Fremont, OH. You could also find her crafting, sewing or cooking. Cinda is survived by her sisters, Susan Rainey, Dianne Mariea, and Emily (Rodney) Gilliland; also left behind to cherish her memory are many nieces, nephews, great-nieces and great-nephews. She was preceded in death by her parents and her loving husband of 36 years. Also preceding her in death are bother-in-laws, Jeffery A. Mariea, and Robert L. Rainey; niece, Sara Gilliland; nephew Jim Rainey along with his wife Jodi; great niece, Jessica Rainey, and great nephews Austin and Cody Rainey.

View Full Obituary

Michael Wasserman - July 30, 1956 - December 09, 2023

Departed: 12/09/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Michael Louis Wasserman, 67, of Fremont, went home to be with his Lord on December 9, 2023. He was born on July 30, 1956, in Fremont, Ohio to Ervin and Anna (Benner) Wasserman of Fremont. Mike was a 1974 graduate of St. Joseph Central Catholic. He married his soulmate, Kathy Damschroder, on January 11, 1985, and worked as a farmer and union carpenter. Mike spent much of his time devoted to his family and volunteering in the community, including SJCC Building Committee, St. Joseph Parish Building Committee, Cemetery Board, among many other fundraisers, projects, and festivals. He was always known for throwing a party at the original shack, many pig roasts, and the Shikin Shack. He had a zest for life and was always willing to lend a hand. He loved his family more than anything. Michael is survived by his children, Nicholas (Maggie O'Brien), Benjamin, Jeffrey Wasserman, and Allison Avery; siblings Suzanne (Rich) Michael, Catherine (Roger) Miller, Florence (John) Swint, Marilyn Babione, Thomas (Denise) Babione; and grandchildren Cooper, Dexter, Logan, and Rooney. He is preceded in death by his parents Ervin and Anna Wasserman; wife Kathy Wasserman; son-in-law Joshua Avery; and sibling William (Sue) Babione. Visitation will be held Friday, December 15, 2023 from 1-5pm at Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home, 416 S. Arch Street, Fremont, Ohio, 43420.

View Full Obituary

Kathleen Snyder - February 08, 1943 - November 20, 2023

Departed: 11/20/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Kathleen "Kathy" Ann Snyder, 80 of Fremont OH passed away peacefully on Monday November 20, 2023 surrounded by family, at Windsor Lanes in Gibsonburg OH. She was born February 8,1943 in Fremont OH to Clifford and Anna Marie ( Haslinger) Jay. Kathy was a 1962 graduate of St. Joseph Catholic High School. She was sassy and funny, strong and independent. She loved playing her lottery tickets and any type of cards or board games. She was very competitive and loved winning! She was also an avid reader till her eyes wouldn't allow it anymore. She loved her children and grandchildren and was so excited for her family to keep expanding with great grandchildren, which she had eight and one on the way. Kathy is survived by her children; Roy (Lisa) Snyder, Reneè (Jamie) Warner, Jay (Angel) Snyder, all of Fremont OH. Grandchildren; Stephanie Snyder, Michael (Ashley) Flores, Derek (Morgan) Flores, Karlie(Cory) Birtcher, Alexis(Keaton) Hill, Donnie (Bralyn) Snyder, and Trey Warner. Brothers; Larry (Mary Jo) Jay of Fremont OH ,John (Lyn) Jay of Perrysburg OH, and many nieces and nephews. She is preceded in death by her son Ricky Allen Snyder, her parents , infant brother Michael Jay, and brothers, Thomas, James, and William Jay. A celebration of Life will be held at a later date

View Full Obituary

John L Baskey - April 08, 1959 - November 16, 2023

Departed: 11/16/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: John Lawrence Baskey, 64, passed away at his Clyde home on November 16, 2023. He was born to Louis and Ruth (Rutan) Baskey on April 8, 1959 in Fremont, Ohio. John was a 1977 graduate of Fremont Ross High School. After graduating high school, John enlisted in the United States Marine Corps. He proudly served his country for four years. John retired from Morgan Advanced Materials Fostoria,OH. Left to honor John’s memory are his daughter; Cynthia (DJ) Brown and son; John (Jacob) Baskey, of Fremont. Also surviving are his brother Michael Baskey of Frezno, CA and sister LouAnn (Eaton) Baskey of Elmore. His ex-wife and friend; Jenny Baskey and seven grandchildren, to which he was extremely proud of: Raelyn, Sofia, Jacob, and Braxton Baskey and Deondray, Jamecyn, and Donivyn Brown all of Fremont; as well as many nieces and nephews. John was preceded in death by his parents, brothers; David, Phillip, and Paul Baskey and niece; Rachelle Baskey. John cherished time spent with his family and adored being a Paw Paw. John enjoyed traveling and being outdoors. He was an avid sports fan, especially of the Cleveland Browns, Cleveland Guardians, and the Ohio State Buckeyes. His kind ways and bright smile will be forever missed.

View Full Obituary

Robert William Baker - May 06, 1931 - November 11, 2023

Departed: 11/11/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Robert (Bob) W. Baker, 92, of Fremont, OH, passed away peacefully at Bethesda Care Center on Saturday, November 11, 2023. Bob was born on May 6, 1931 in Green Springs, OH. He was the youngest of 5 children born to Franklin N. and Aleta (Insley) Baker. Bob was a veteran of the US Air Force, in which he was a jet mechanics instructor during the Korean War. He married the love of his life, Audrey M. Stiles, in 1952 in Amarillo, Texas. They spent just shy of 62 beautiful years together until she went home to be with the Lord in 2014. Bob was a Journeyman Millwright at Whirlpool Corp. in Clyde, OH for 44 ½ years. He was given special recognition for perfect attendance! He enjoyed traveling, going to swap meets, working on cars and anything to do with working with his hands. Bob was preceded in death by his beloved wife, his parents, sisters Dora Perry and Claribel Rathbun and brothers Clarence, who was killed in combat during WWII, and Raymond. He is survived by his loving and beloved son and daughter-in-law, Rick and Karradiene, 2 grandchildren, Andrea and Brandon, 5 great-grandchildren, Kaytlynn, Elijah, Braden, Nevaeh and Riley, 1 great, great-grandchild, Eila, nieces Sharon and Tina and special nephew, Lonnie (Ayako) Bowling. Visitation will be Friday, November 17th from 10a-12p at Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home, 416 S Arch St, Fremont, OH. Services will begin at 12:00 pm. Burial will be at Greenlawn Memory Gardens, 1793 W McPherson Hwy, Clyde, OH with military honors. The family wishes to thank Bethesda Care Center for providing excellent care during his time with them. Hanneman Funeral Homes is honored to serve Robert's family and encourage those to share a fond memory or condolence by visiting www.hannemanfuneralhomes.com.

View Full Obituary

Jane A Mosser - November 28, 1926 - September 27, 2023

Departed: 09/27/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Jane Ann Mosser, 96, of Fremont, passed away peacefully on September 27, 2023, surrounded by her family and friends. She was born in Toledo, OH on November 28, 1926, to the late Anthony and Mary (Zawodny) Dobrzykowski. Jane graduated in 1944 from St. Ursula Academy in Toledo, OH. On September 3, 1949, she married Richard J. Mosser at St. Teresa’s Catholic Church in Toledo, OH. Jane and her husband enjoyed music, parties and people. She enjoyed visiting museums and had a great appreciation for history, architecture, and the fine arts. She was well known for playing her accordion or piano at parties, and having sing-a-longs. She had a very sharp memory until the end and she was always up to a good debate on politics. Jane was preceded in death by her parents, husband, daughter Sheila A. Stine, son, Dennis A. Mosser, son-in-law, Jon A. Stine and sister Ruth Szymanski. Those left to cherish her memory include her daughters, Sara J. (Larry) Brenot, Susan M. (Michael) Coleman, Sandra L. Mosser all of Fremont, and Shannon L. (Dalzel) Williams of Britton, MI. She is also survived by 8 grandchildren and 7 great-grandchildren.

View Full Obituary

Judith Molyet - June 04, 1950 - September 20, 2023

Departed: 09/20/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Judith Molyet, 73, of Fremont sadly left us on September 20, 2023 surrounded by her loved ones. She was a very loving mother, daughter, and grandmother. She was born June 4, 1950 to Pearl and Henry Bartlett. She graduated from Fremont Ross High School and later received an associate’s degree from Terra Community College. She married Richard Molyet on April 19, 1997. Judith is survived by her husband Richard; daughters Cindy Pasch (Fred Meacham), Julie Kaiser; sons Jose (Melissa) Ortiz II, Michael (Carrie) Molyet; grandchildren, Cory, Justin, Jimmy, Tashia, Sam, Katelyn, Jose, Elle, and Evan; great grandchildren, Noah, Mason, Grace, Ellie and Nolan; brother Robert Bartlett, and sister Barbra Mooney. She was preceded in death by her parents; sisters, Rosie Kaiser, Sharon Cooley, Margret Effinger, Henrietta Stout; brothers Ronald Bartlett and Howard Bartlett.

View Full Obituary

Wallace "Wally" Heminger - February 09, 1943 - September 12, 2023

Departed: 09/12/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Wallace "Wally" Heminger Jr., 80, of Fremont, passed away at his home on September 12, 2023. Wally was born February 9, 1943 in Attica, OH to the late Wallace Heminger Sr. and Helen Frisch. Wally had a life long passion for all things racing. He could be seen on the track in either car number 27 or 44. In 2010, he was inducted into Fremont Speedway Hall of Fame. He is survived by his fiancé, Norma Sager; son, Jerry (Kim) Heminger; brother, Larry Heminger; and grandchildren, Adam Heminger, Heather Heminger, Michael Heminger, Emilee Valle, and Jessica Valle. Wally was preceded in death by his parents; daughter, Joyce Valle, and sister, Caroline Yates.

View Full Obituary

Dorothy P Fick - November 19, 1922 - September 10, 2023

Departed: 09/10/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Dorothy P. Fick, 100, of Fremont, passed away peacefully on September 10, 2023 at Elmwood Assisted Living with her two sons by her side. She was born November 19, 1922 in Fremont to Arthur and Clara Kramer. A graduate of Fremont High School, she married Paul Fick on February 1, 1947. He precedes her in death. In her younger years, Dorothy's devotion was always her three sons. She kept an immaculate house and enjoyed tending to her flower gardens. Later in life, Dorothy and Paul enjoyed traveling. They enjoyed going to South Carolina to visit family, and they especially enjoyed going to Myrtle Beach. She was a big fan of any sport her grandchildren were playing as well as The Ohio State Buckeyes and the Washington Nationals. One thing that brought her great joy also was watching the Lawrence Welk Show! Dorothy is survived by sons, John (RoseAnn) Fick of Westerville, OH, and Joseph (Jill) Fick of Fremont; daughter-in-law, Betty Fick of Bluffton, SC; sister, Norma Gabel of Fremont; grandchildren Timothy (Bonnie) Fick, Tami (Troy) Velliquette, both of Bluffton, SC, Jodi (Mike) Rizzo of Washington D.C. and Jessica (Antonio) Quarterman of Kennedy Township, PA; great-grandchildren, Tyler and Brendan Fick, Logan Velliquette, Colton and Austin Quarterman and Santino "Sonny" Rizzo; along with many nieces and nephews. She was preceded in death by her parents, her husband in 2013; son, James; and sisters, Mercedes Lyons, Alberta Murphy and Bernadine Guyer.

View Full Obituary

Veronica Jane Rodriguez - October 18, 1943 - August 20, 2023

Departed: 08/20/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Veronica Jane (Pendleton) Rodriguez, 79, of Fremont, Ohio, passed away peacefully at home, surrounded by her loving family on Sunday, August 20th, 2023. She was born in Jersey City, NJ, on October 18, 1943, to the late Ralph and Mona Pendleton. Veronica (known as Roni to her many friends) grew up in Pennsylvania and graduated from Conemaugh Township High School located in Davidsville, PA. She was preceded in death by her brothers, James Pendleton of Johnstown, PA, Ronald Pendleton of Rural Hall, NC, and her sister, Annette Krisko of Portage, PA. Veronica married Salvador Rodriguez in 1966. They had three children: a daughter, Monna' Kline (Jim), and two sons, Salvador Rodriguez II (Kim Hrynciw) and Earl Rodriguez (Nanci). However, she was a mother to many others who loved her. Roni had many professional talents, including a painting/wallpaper business, and she was a Hospice home caregiver. Roni had a gift for easily making friends, as her love for her family and friends was undeniable. One of her favorite hobbies was her love for gardening flowers and spending time upkeeping her pond; together they created a beautiful environment within her own yard. Roni was an avid reader and an animal lover. She was an active member of Al-Anon/Alateen and the most wonderful "Granny" to Erika Garcia (Gabriel), Elise Kline, Sydni Rodriguez, Amyra Ruffing, Trent Rodriguez, McKenzie Rodriguez, Dane Rodriguez (Kay), Brissa Rodriguez, and six great-grandchildren whom she loved dearly. Memorial services will be held at Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home on Monday, August 28th. Visitation will be from 2-4 pm, with the service starting at 4 pm. Memorial donations may be made in Roni's name to Hospice or the Humane Society of Sandusky County. Online condolences as well as fond memories may be shared with Roni's family by visiting www.hannemanfuneralhomes.com.

View Full Obituary

Bernadine Fox - December 13, 1931 - July 19, 2023

Departed: 07/19/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Bernadine Lucy Fox, peacefully passed away on July 19, 2023, in Fremont, Ohio, at the age of 91. She was born on December 13, 1931, in Millersville, Ohio, to the late Alfred and Cecelia (Toeppe) Foos. Bernie was a loving and devoted mother to her son Thomas (Carla) Fox and daughter Regina (Joseph) Loudon. She cherished her role as a grandmother to Suzette (Jason) Rosskopf, Brandy (Mark) Morris, Brittany (Robert) Knieriemen, Kristen (Michael) Fox, Erin (Scott) Runyan, Johnny Honebrink, Jakob Loudon, and Luke Loudon. Bernie also took great joy in being a great grandmother to Logan Crowel, Brendin Morris, Bryce Morris, Ayva Fox, Brody Knieriemen and Thomas Knieriemen. In addition to her children and grandchildren, Bernie is survived by her brothers Norbert (Madonna) Foos, Herman (Rosie) Foos, and Vincent Foos. She was preceded in death by her beloved husband, Herbert Fox, her son Victor Fox, and her infant children Michael and Karen Fox. Bernie also mourned the loss of her sister Dolores Wagner, brother-in-law Robert Wagner, and sister-in-law Rita Foos. Bernie graduated from Millersville High School. She enjoyed square dancing. Thats where she met the love of her life Herbert Fox at Meadowbrook Park. She was a longtime member of Sacred Heart Catholic Church, where she found solace and comfort in her faith. In her free time, Bernie enjoyed indulging in her hobbies, which included gardening, sewing, crafts and puzzles. She had a green thumb and took great pride in her beautiful garden. Bernie's talent for sewing and crafts was evident in the thoughtful creations she made. Her love for puzzles challenged her mind and provided hours of entertainment. Bernie's warm smile, kind heart, and unwavering love for her family and friends will be deeply missed. Her legacy of love and dedication to her loved ones will forever be cherished. Please keep Bernie and her loved ones in your thoughts and prayers during this difficult time.

View Full Obituary

Walter E Anspach - November 25, 1928 - July 14, 2023

Departed: 07/14/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Walter E. Anspach, 94, a lifelong Fremont resident, passed away Friday July 14, 2023 at Ottawa County Riverview Care Center in Oak Harbor. He was born November 25, 1928 in Fremont OH, the son of Walter E. and Anna (Wyss) Anspach. Walter was a graduate of Fremont Ross High School and went on to serve in the United States Army. During Walter’s military service, he was stationed in Korea as a Sargent in the infantry. He was severely wounded in battle making him a Purple Heart recipient along with many other awards for combat duty. On December 12, 1955 he married Ruth E. Keller. Walter retired from Consolite Corporation as a silk screen processor. As a second job, Walter did painting and wallpapering. He enjoyed eating at the local establishments, but especially Whitey’s Diner. Walter also enjoyed antique hunting and keeping up his yard and home. He enjoyed spending time with family and was proud of his only grandson Zach. He was a long-time member of Sacred Heart Parish in Fremont, OH. Surviving is his daughter Candice (Steve) Hampshire and grandson Zachary Hampshire both of Fremont, OH; sister Norma Harringan of Sandusky, OH. Walter was preceded in death by his parents; wife of 64 years, Ruth; son James M. Anspach; siblings Lucille Heid, Mary Ann Krauss, Lucy Dorfmeyer, and John B. Anspach.

Maureen Gedert - May 11, 1936 - June 02, 2023

Departed: 06/02/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Maureen A. Gedert, of Catawba Island Township and formerly of Fremont, Ohio, died June 2, 2023, at Otterbein Marblehead, where she had been a resident since 2019. She celebrated her 87th birthday on May 11. On that date in 1936, Maureen was born a twin in Toledo, Ohio, to Daniel M. and Gertrude H. Rahilly. Maureen and her family grew up in the Old West End neighborhood in Toledo. She graduated from Central Catholic High School in 1954. Maureen had a desire to help other people, and so she attended Mercy Hospital School of Nursing. She received her nursing degree in 1957. It was during her time at Mercy Hospital that Maureen met the love of her life, Robert Gedert, a young medical intern working on his general surgery residency. From that moment on, they were a power duo: Maureen and Bob, Buz and Buzzy, Mo and Bo, nurse and doctor. They were married on May 9, 1959, at Rosary Cathedral in Toledo. They spent almost 60 wonderful years together before Dr. Gedert's death on Jan. 13, 2018. After their wedding, the couple moved to New York City to work and so Bob could complete his medical residency at Memorial Sloan Kettering. In 1963, the couple returned to Northwest Ohio to start a family. They settled on Hayes Avenue in Fremont, where they raised their children and made lifelong friends. Maureen stayed home to care for the family, but returned to work at Memorial Hospital in Fremont after her youngest graduated high school. Maureen worked as a surgical nurse with her husband in the operating room every morning, and as a nurse in his office every afternoon. Mom and Dad loved to work together helping to heal people, a notable accomplishment for the couple. Maureen was a member of the Toledo Diocesan Council of Nurses and the Women's Auxiliary of Memorial Hospital, where she served for many years as chairman. Upon their retirement, Maureen and Bob moved to their lakefront home in Catawba Island Township, where they enjoyed boat rides, swimming off their dock and watching amazing sunsets over Lake Erie. Maureen had many friends and knew no strangers. She was a great conversationalist and had a spunky sense of humor. She enjoyed cooking; golfing; playing bridge with friends; gardening; reading; praying the rosary; hanging out with family pets; helping stray animals; and going to dinner parties. She and Bob also enjoyed taking weeks-long trips during the winter to Florida, to see their son and daughter-in-law. Maureen liked to spend time with her young grandson, Aidan Meister, and the two of them could frequently be found walking Aidan's dog, Fletch, hanging out at the library or eating at McDonald's. If you were friends with one of Maureen's kids, you were one of her kids, too, and you could count on getting not only advice, but sometimes help with an injury or illness. Maureen was a member of St. Joseph Catholic Church in Marblehead. Surviving are son, Paul Gedert (Saloa) of Boca Raton, Fla.; daughters Roberta Meister (Eric), and Beth Gedert, both of Port Clinton; grandsons Aidan Meister and Nicholas Rendon; special niece, Shelby Rahilly Jasmer and numerous other family members. In addition to her husband, Maureen was preceded in death by her son, Daniel J. Gedert; her parents; her twin brother, Larry, who died in infancy; and brother, Robert Rahilly.

Sandra Louise Grubs - January 05, 1937 - May 31, 2023

Departed: 05/31/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Sande Grubs, 86 years old, of Fremont, Ohio, passed away in her sleep on Wednesday, May 31. Sande was born on January 5th, 1937, to Tim and Alice McCarthy. She graduated from Fremont Ross in 1955, and went on to The Ohio State University where she got her degree as a Dental Hygienist. Her career was spent in Woodville, working as a hygienist for Dr. Vernon Slotterbeck, and after his retirement, for Dr. Kenneth Myers. Sande met the love of her life, Ralph (Grubby) through her older brother, Tom (also deceased.) They were married in 1957 and had three children, Lisa, Barry and Lezlie. Sande was strong,funny, determined and thoughtful. She loved dogs, cats, the squirrels she fed, the geese that flew overhead, and the wild turkeys that visited her yard often. She threw epic parties, was a die hard Buckeye fan, a loving wife and mother. She loved the beach and being in the sun, cooking, reading, playing Mahjong and napping. Sande was predeceased by her father, Timothy McCarthy, her mother, Alice McCarthy, her brother Thomas McCarthy, and her husband Ralph Grubs, Jr. She is survived by her children Lisa Ashcraft (T.J.), Barry Grubs (John Pancake), and Lezlie Weimer and brother Michael McCarthy. There will be a funeral mass at 10 a.m. on Friday, June 23 at St. Ann's Catholic Church in Fremont, OH with a reception to follow at Live Edge (115 S. Front St.) Donations can be made to The Humane Society of Sandusky or of Ottawa County, or to the charity of choice. Hanneman Funeral Homes is honored to serve Sandra's family and encourage those to share a fond memory or condolence by visiting www.hannemanfuneralhomes.com.

Gary Mazey - October 06, 1940 - May 29, 2023

Departed: 05/29/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Gary Mazey, 82, passed away on May 29, 2023 at Elmwood Skilled Nursing Facility. Born in Perrysburg, OH, he was the eldest son of the late Virgil and Gladys Mazey (Britten). Gary was preceded in death by brother James (Jacque) Mazey. Four siblings survive: Patricia (Roger) Smith, Susan Hudson, Janice (Dave) Foulke, and Rick (Lois) Mazey. As a member of the Carpenters Local 351, Gary was a master carpenter and craftsman. He led the construction and supervision of several multi-million-dollar commercial projects during his tenure as a tradesman. In his earlier years he was a member of the Van Buren Lions Club 5179 and an Allen Township volunteer firefighter. After retirement from the trades, Gary designed and built his dream home in the Colorado mountains where he and his wife Patsy lived for almost 20 years. When Gary wasn't in his workshop, he enjoyed motorcycle rides, hunting, old westerns, and listening to classic country music. Gary is survived by his four children: Mindy Ackerman, Patrick Mazey, Sherry (Michael) Molzhon, and Megan (Michael) Beard as well as his wife Patsy Mazey and her six daughters Lynnette (Chuck) Bates, Linda (Michael) Enden, Rhonda (Tom) McDonald, Lisa (Dwight) Clary, Amy (Jim) Barnes, and Jenny (David) Echols. In addition to his son and daughters, Gary has 22 grandchildren and 43 great-grandchildren. A memorial service will be held on June 6, 2023 at 12:00 PM. The family will receive visitors starting at 11:00 AM (1-hour) prior to the service. Location: Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home, 416 South Arch Street, Fremont, OH 43420. Memorial contributions may be made to: Van Buren Lions Club 5179 or Shriners Hospitals for Children. Hanneman Funeral Homes is honored to serve Gary's family and encourage those to share a fond memory or condolence by visiting www.hannemanfuneralhomes.com.

Franklin Eugene Dietz - July 14, 1927 - May 21, 2023

Departed: 05/21/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Franklin E. (Euie) Dietz, 95, of Clyde, Ohio died May 21st of 2023. Frank retired from First Energy in 1987 with 35 years of service from the Eastern District, Lindsey, Ohio. Born July 14, 1927 in New Bedford, Ohio. He attended New Bedford Elementary School then Baltic High School where he was drafted in July 1945. He served in the Philippine Islands at Clark Army Air Force Base. When discharged he received the WWII Victory Medal and the Philippine Independence Ribbon. He was the son of Clarence R. and Alta M. (Ely) Dietz. His wife of 60 years Colleen, preceded him on April 9, 2011 and his son Gregory on November 21, 2020. He is survived by one son, Dereck of Romulus, Michigan; a sister and three nephews in Millerburg, Ohio; four nephews in Lakeside Marblehead, Ohio, and one niece in St. Petersburg, Florida. A memorial service will be held on Saturday, June 10, 2023 from 10:00 am until the time of her funeral service at 12:00 pm at Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home 416 South Arch Street, Fremont Ohio. Burial to follow services at Oakwood Cemetery. Hanneman Funeral Homes is honored to serve Frank's family and encourage those to share a fond memory or condolence by visiting www.hannemanfuneralhomes.com.

Irene Rimelspach - July 05, 1929 - May 19, 2023

Departed: 05/19/2023 (Fremont)

Obituary Preview: Irene E. (Halm) Rimelspach, 93 of Fremont, Ohio passed away Friday, May 19, 2023 surrounded by her loving family. Irene was born on July 5, 1929 to the late Stan and Ursula (Wasserman) Halm in Fremont, Ohio. She married the love of her life Bill on November 24, 1949 at St. Joseph Catholic Church in Fremont. They were married 72 years before he preceded her in death on July 16, 2022. Irene is survived by her children: Joseph (Judy) Rimelspach of Columbus, Susan Rimelspach of Cincinnati, Mark (Sue) Rimelspach of Findlay, Mary (Michael) Smith of Strongsville, Ann (Allan) Wise of Fremont and John Rimelspach of Port Clinton; grandchildren: Paul Rimelspach, Sara (John) Bartley, Anna (Xaume) Bueno, Dan (Mary) Rimelspach, Derek Rimelspach, Meghan (Mike) Rimelspach, Drew (Hannah) Rimelspach, Tracey Smith, Brian Smith, Carolynn (Nicholas) Oblizajek, Katie Wise, Molly (Dale) Freier, and Christine (Zak) Bowman; great-grandchildren: Penny, Holden, Alana, Whitney, Addison, Lydia, Liam, Malachi, Grace, Marnie, Coraline, Maple, Sophie and Alden; Irene was preceded in death by her parents: husband Bill, siblings: Billy, Thomas, Florence, and Glenn. Irene was a 1947 graduate of St. Joseph Catholic High School. She worked as a school secretary at St. Ann's School for 14 years. Irene volunteered for numerous community organizations and events. Irene will be remembered by her family and friends as an extremely open hearted, passionately competitive and accepting person. Irene welcomed all those in her life with genuine kindness and unconditional love. She enjoyed quilting beautiful blankets, playing cards and being by the water which included swimming any chance she got. If you were lucky enough to know Irene, you may have had a chance to enjoy one of her delicious and "healthy" pies! Irene loved spending time with her family sharing many traditions with them such as making cherries jubilee every Christmas and warning her many grandchildren they "daresn't touch the tree" during the annual pickle hunt. She was a strong and beautiful soul, and meant so much to her loved ones. Irene made everyone feel like family and taught those around her that devotion to family and faith were the keys to happiness (and winning at euchre certainly helped too). Irene's family is brought comfort knowing she is in heaven reunited with her loving husband Bill, talking, laughing and dancing to Glen Miller. Visitation for Irene will be on Tuesday, May 23, 2023 from 4-8 PM in the Hanneman-Keller Funeral Home, 416 S. Arch St., Fremont, Ohio 43420, where a Vigil Service will be held at 7:30PM. Irene's Mass of Christian Burial will be held on Wednesday, May 24, 2023 at 10:00 AM in the St. Ann Catholic Church, 1021 W. State St., Fremont, Ohio 43420, with Fr. Matt Frisbee, celebrant. Interment will follow in the St. Joseph Cemetery. Memorial contributions may be made in Irene's honor to Meals on Wheels Sandusky County, or St Ann Catholic Church. The Rimelspach family would like to thank and recognize the loving staff at Valley View and Promedica Hospice for the loving care of Irene. Online condolences, as well as a fond memory, may be shared with Irene's family by visiting www.hannemanfuneralhomes.com

Frequently Asked Questions

What is an obituary?

An obituary is a written notice that announces the death of a person, typically including their name, age, date of birth and death, and a brief biography. It may also include information about their family, accomplishments, and any notable achievements.

Why are obituaries important?

Obituaries serve as a way to inform friends, family, and community members of a person's passing, allowing them to pay their respects and offer condolences. They also provide a permanent record of the person's life and legacy.

Who typically writes an obituary?

In most cases, the family of the deceased or a close friend writes the obituary. Funeral homes or mortuaries may also offer assistance in writing and publishing obituaries.

What information should be included in an obituary?

A typical obituary includes the person's full name, age, date of birth and death, place of residence, occupation, education, military service, hobbies, and surviving family members. It may also include information about memorial services, charitable donations, or other relevant details.

How long should an obituary be?

The length of an obituary can vary depending on the publication and the family's preferences. Typically, it ranges from a few sentences to several paragraphs.

Can I include photos in an obituary?

Yes, many publications allow you to include one or more photos with the obituary. This can be a great way to personalize the tribute and help readers remember the person.

How do I submit an obituary to a newspaper or online platform?

Check the publication's website or contact their obituary department directly for submission guidelines. Some platforms may require online forms or email submissions, while others may accept phone or in-person submissions.

Is there a cost associated with publishing an obituary?

Yes, most publications charge a fee for publishing an obituary. The cost varies depending on the length of the obituary, the number of publications, and other factors.

Can I write my own obituary before I pass away?

Yes, some people choose to write their own obituaries in advance. This can ensure that their life story is told accurately and with their own voice.

What is the difference between an obituary and a death notice?

A death notice is a brief announcement of a person's passing, usually including only basic information such as name, age, and date of death. An obituary provides more detailed information about the person's life and legacy.

Can I include humor or personal anecdotes in an obituary?

Absolutely! Obituaries can be a celebration of the person's life, so feel free to include humorous stories or personal touches that capture their personality.

How do I handle sensitive or private information in an obituary?

Be respectful and considerate when sharing sensitive information. If necessary, omit certain details or use discretion when discussing private matters.

Can I include quotes or poems in an obituary?

Yes! Quotes, poems, or lyrics can add depth and meaning to an obituary. Choose something that resonates with the person's spirit or reflects their personality.

What if I need to make corrections to an already-published obituary?

Contact the publication immediately if you need to make corrections. They will work with you to rectify any errors and republish the corrected version.

How long does it take for an obituary to be published?

The timeframe varies depending on the publication's schedule and deadlines. Online platforms may publish immediately, while print newspapers may take several days or weeks.

Can I reprint an obituary from another publication?

You may need permission from the original publication or author to reprint an obituary. Be sure to check copyright laws and obtain necessary permissions before reproducing someone else's work.

What if I want to publish an obituary in multiple languages?

This is possible! Many publications offer translation services or accept submissions in multiple languages. Check with individual publications for their policies.

Are there any specific guidelines for writing an obituary for a veteran?

Yes! When writing an obituary for a veteran, be sure to include their military service information, awards, and honors. You may also want to consider including patriotic elements or symbols.

Can I include information about memorial donations in an obituary?

Absolutely! Many families prefer memorial donations over flowers or other tributes. Include details about the charity or organization benefiting from these donations.

How do I find archived copies of old obituaries?

You can search online archives, visit local libraries or genealogical societies, or contact the publication directly to request archived copies of old obituaries.

Can I create a digital archive of my loved one's obituary?

Yes! Consider creating a digital archive by saving a copy of the obituary as a PDF or image file. You can also share it on social media or online memorials.

What if I need help writing an obituary due to emotional distress?

DON'T hesitate to ask for help! Funeral homes, grief counselors, or trusted friends and family members can assist you in writing an obituary during this difficult time.

Sometimes! Check with the publication first to see if they allow external links. Online memorials can be a wonderful way to share memories and celebrate your loved one's life.

How do I ensure accuracy when writing an obituary?

Can I write an obituary for someone who has been deceased for many years?

Absolutely! Writing an belated obituary can still serve as a meaningful tribute and provide closure for loved ones. Consider sharing it on online platforms or through family networks.
